title: Spare Hours
author: Brown, John
snippet: As we passed through Slateford, he spoke of Dr. Belfrage, hisgreat-hearted friend, of his obligations to him, and of his son, myfriend, both lying together in Colinton churchyard; and of Dr. Dick, whowas minister before him, of the Coventrys, and of Stitchel andSprouston, of his mother, and of himself,—his doubts of his ownsincerity in religion, his sense of sin, of God—reverting often to hisdying friend.

title: Black's picturesque tourist of Scotland.
snippet: At the distance of two miles from Kelso, are the station and village of Sprouston, where passengers may also leave for Kelso.

title: Tweed and Don; or, Recollections and reflections of an angler for the last fifty years ...
author: Locke, James.
snippet: rivers can be purchased at Mr Forrest's, and James Wright, Sprouston, is a capital maker of both salmon and trout flies.

title: Rab and his friends and other dogs and men,
author: Brown, John
snippet: As we passed through Slateford, he spoke of Dr. Belfrage, his great-hearted friend, of his obligations to him, and of his son, my friend, both lying together in Colinton churchyard ; and of Dr. Dick, who was minister before him, of the Coventrys, and of Stitchel and Sprouston, of his mother, and of himself, his doubts of his own sincerity in religion, his sense of sin, of God, reverting often to his dying friend.
